project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When creating an issue, the prefilled project is the one most recently 'loaded' as opposed to being set from the board currently being viewed.

For example, if view an Agile board driven by Project A and then click Create Issue, it will populate the Project field with Project A.

However, if I:
1. View the board for Project A
2. Open the board for Project B in a new tab
3. Switch back to the tab with the Project A board and create a new issue

I observe that the prepopulated value is Project B, even though I am viewing the board for Project A. Note that regular JIRA exhibits the same behaviour if we substitute Agile Boards for the project view.

This is just a minor QoL change, but it's all these little things that combine to make a great, seamless UX so I figured it would be worth raising. Thanks!
fields.summary: As a user viewing a rapid board, I would like any issues I create to default to the project driving the board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I am discriminating between two of my product backlogs by use of a custom field, which identifies the hardware type that the issue applies to.

However, though I can populate the custom field when I raise the issue as an epic, via the normal 'Create issue' dialog, it is not possible when I press create Epic.
Because my AgileBoard is based upon a filter which finds issues with a particular value in this custom field, and I have not had an opportunity to set the field, the newly created epic does not appear in the board.

Therefore can custom fields be added to the creation of the epic?
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to configure which custom fields can appear when using the 'Create Epic' screen

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Being able to base Swimlanes on Stories or Assignee is simply not enough. JQL is great but what I keep hearing from managers in our company that want to use Kanban is that they want to be able to do a "group by" similar to a group by clause in SQL.

Our biggest win would be to add Component to the "Base Swimlanes on" dropdown. Even better would be to add "Attribute" to the dropdown with a text box allowing someone to enter the attribute to group on; from there they could pick "Epic Name", Assignee, Component, etc...
fields.summary: As a manager with a Kanban Board, I want to be able to dynamically group my board by an attribute so that I may more easily organize my team's work

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently you can only start the sprint that is at the head of the Plan section of the board.  Although the ability to move sprints around (which has been requested in GHS-6131) would somewhat ease this restriction it would also be very useful if ALL sprints on the plan had a 'start' button.  That way if you decide you want to start a sprint that happens to be lower down the board you can do it in only one click, with no need to do any re-arranging.
fields.summary: As a user I would like a 'start sprint' button on all Sprints on 'Plan' Board

Can you please change the sprint field to make it so that if you type the version number it looks up the relevant versions and you can select from there  (as you already do in the filters?

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I am using Jira 6.1 and Jira Agile 6.3.3

When moving issues from the backlog to a sprint, I usually rank them in the backlog first and then select the top five and move them together (using ctrl + click) in to an active sprint. When I drop the bunch of issues selected in a particular place within the sprint, I assume the rank field gets updated and the rank is adjusted accordingly since I want it to be maintained. But as soon as I refresh the page those issues get scattered around the sprint.

If I am dropping the issues at a particular location, it is definitely with the intention of maintaining the ranking in the active sprint. But after a refresh the ranking seems to be random because even the bunch of issues I just dropped get swapped between them.

It works fine when each issue is ranked individually. But we have large sprints and we do not always schedule issues one at a time, making this a huge inconvenience.
fields.summary: Moving issues from one sprint to another does not maintain the rank of the issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Sprint Marker Migration described at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Sprint+Marker+Migration has an error when it recognizes whether there are Boards that need migration.

We had a Scrumboard that matches the criteria 

{{(SPRINT_MARKERS_MIGRATED <> true or SPRINT_MARKERS_MIGRATED is null) and SPRINTS_ENABLED = true}}

but the board was deleted.

So there was no way to get the warning away except of hiding it which is bad as you then are not sure whether all boards that need migration are actually migrated. (Besides it would be handy to see the list of boards that still need migration, at least as Administrator if there are security concerns.)

I worked around this by setting sprints_enabled to false in the database directly. After this the message was gone as it was the last board that Agile thought needs migration.
fields.summary: Sprint Marker Migration needed check is erroneous

the ''Blocker'' indication on the Sprint Health gadget generically selects all issues that have the highest priority.

Different prioritization and sprint management needs generate a need to different definitions as to what is a ''Blocker''.

It would be needed to be able to customize the results in the agile health gadget to display the stats from custom filters rather then a fixed definition.

Thank you,
fields.summary: Allow customization of Agile Sprint Health Gadget filters

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Selecting an assignee from the agile sprint health gadget is not working for us as we have our user management connected to an external directory.

This forces us to have usernames formatted similar to an e-mail address, but the period in the username is not escaped when selecting the assignee.  The gadget should at least enclose the name in a string.

''Error in the JQL Query: The character '.' is a reserved JQL character. You must enclose it in a string or use the escape '\u002e' instead. (line 1, character 18)''
fields.summary: Agile Sprint Health Gadget should enclose assignee names in a string

fields.description:
When selecting a quick filter, the selected filters are saved according to the mode they were selected in:

Ex: I select Quick filter ''A'' in Plan mode.
-I go to work mode, I have to reselect quick filter''A''
-I add quick filter ''B'' in Work mode, I return to plan mode
-Plan mode will still only have ''A'' Selected.

It would be great if the selected quick filter would carry over.

Thank you,
fields.summary: As a user, i'd like to have my selected quick filters maintain themselves across both plan and work mode.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The *Apply* button of _Refine Report_ of the Cumulative Flow Diagram is not visible when there is many Columns/Swimlanes/Quick Filters.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Board
# Configure many Columns/Swimlanes/Quick Filters
# Access the Cumulative Flow Diagram and try to refine the report

h3. Expected Results
# Users are able to refine and click on the *Apply* button as normal

h3. Actual Results
The *Apply* button is hidden because it is at the bottom of the screen
!2013-11-14 19 58 38.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
Happens in all browsers

h3.Workaround
Some might find it possible to scroll down by clicking and dragging downwards as if they want to highlight texts. However, this does not work in some cases and for these users, there are no workarounds.
fields.summary: Huge amount of quick filters makes apply button disappear in report view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If the issue was released in one version and reopened, it is still considered as part of that sprint.

!versionbox.png|thumbnail!

h4.Cause

The issue list is generated based on the fixversion only while the version summary is generated based on the fixversion + release version history. In this case, the issue that previously belong to this sprint will still having the same release version history to the previous sprint.

h4.Correct behavior

The version summary should show exactly the same number of issue as listed in the board.
fields.summary: Inconsistency between the navigator and the version summary in classic board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Using the following query, we'd expect the Issue Navigator to display the User Stories in order of their rank as shown on the Plan mode of the rapid board:

{noformat}
project = XX AND issueType = "User Story" AND status != Done ORDER BY Rank ASC
{noformat}

The behavior is as follows:

-- If you have just a backlog, the Issue Navigator displays the issues in proper order.
-- If you have a backlog and a sprint or sprints configured and you reorder the issues within the sprint or in the backlog or even between the sprint and the backlog, the issues are displayed in the proper order.
-- If you have more than one sprint configured and you start moving issues around BETWEEN sprints, not just within a sprint, the order of issues gets messed up in the Issue Navigator. But once you get to the first issue in the backlog in the Issue Navigator results then the order is accurate again.
fields.summary: Error ranking issues when moving them in the board

fields.description:
When ranking a stack of issues, the issues move to the new area of the rank order, but their relative rank is scrambled. For instance, if I have the following issues: FOO-10,FOO-11,FOO-12,FOO-13 and I grab them as a group and rank them above FOO-5, they will move to the right spot, but their order in relation to each other will change. They will end up with an order like: FOO-11,FOO-10,FOO-12,FOO-13.

As a User, I'd like consistency when ranking stacks of issues so I can expect consistent results.
fields.summary: When moving a stack of issues in Plan Mode, the issues in the stack should retain their relative ranking order

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I've really been digging the flexibility of the new Agile board, but have hit one blocker that I can't get around. 
*Short explanation:* I'd like to be able to display cards on the board in RANK order, but disable the ability to move the RANK of the cards on the same board.
*Long explanation:* I am experimenting with managing the requirements definiton and project portfolio prioritization with several boards based on the same project, each giving a different view of the issues in the project. The Project is really my project portfolio, and each task represents a potential project that could impact one or more of our systems. I have one board that I want to use with the stakeholders to establish the overall priority of the initiatives. The card format is very useful for visualizing everything in the portfolio and allowing us to reorder priorties on the fly. (I have two basic columns for this -- "Unprioritized" and "Prioritized.")
I have another board I want to use to track the progress of the requirements definition. I have two statuses defined in my custom workflow - "Prioritized" and "Defining." What I'd love to be able to do is display all the initiatives in priority (RANK) order and drag the cards between "Prioritized" and "Defining," but not allow the rank assigned to the card on the planning board (whose column "Prioritized" contains both statuses, "Prioritized" and "Defining") to be modified on this screen. When I remove the "Order by" clause in the filter it disables the RANK feature, but it also displays the cards in random order, making it difficult for the team to quickly see what should be their next priority for their requirements process.
fields.summary: As a project manager, I'd like to disable ranking (moving of cards) on a board, but display the cards in RANK order so that I may manage project prioritization on one board and requirements definition on another

fields.description:
I don't understand why users that haven't got the shared object permission can make a copy of a board from the option "Manage boards" and can't make it from the Tools menu at the top right of the screen.

h4. Summary
*Manage board* page disregards the _create shared object_ global permission, which still allows the users without this permission to copy the board

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Revoke the _create shared object_ global permission from a JIRA user
# Go to *manage boards* page
# Refer to a specific board > refer to the triple dots button

h4. Expected Result
User should not be able to copy the board. The copy option should be grayed out

h4. Actual Result
User is able to copy the board. 
!copy.png|thumbnail!

However, if the user loads the board and try to copy it from there (click on board button), the copy option is grayed out
!copy2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Permissions to copy a board are inconsistent

fields.description:
We are using rapid board (SCRUM option) to control our sprints.

Instead of using story points, we've decided to use original estimate as the base (effort) for our burndown. However, the original estimate is not directly defined on the stories. Instead of that, we detail our stories in subtasks, we inform the original estimate (effort) for all the subtasks and, after that, JIRA just INDIRECTLY accumulates the sum of its subtasks as the story's original estimate.

The problem is (please see screenshots attached):
- Scrum Board (Plan mode) does not show the sum of estimated hours on the respective spot.
- Due that, Scrum Board (Report mode) - Velocity Chart - also does not show the chart with the information registered. The bar chart demonstrates no information, because it does not recognize the amount of hours (remaining / registered) on subtasks.

After a quick test, I've discovered:
- The features mentioned above ONLY WORKS if the hour estimates (original time estimate) were informed DIRECTLY on the stories. It means, a story WITH NO subtasks.

In short, this situation does not fit for us. We really need to decompose our stories in subtasks and, after that, simply let the scrum rapid board (no matter the mode [plan | work | report]) do its job.

Finally, if you need more information, please just let a comment.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Scrum Board does not show sum of Estimated Hours when Stories have sub-tasks

h3.Steps to produce:
# Create a custom Rank field and create few issues with that custom field
# Go to _Board_ and choose *Configure*
# In the _Filter_ tab, click on Edit Filter Query link.
# Edit the filter to choose the Custom field for ranking the issues, and click *Save*
# Go back to your board, you will notice that you are not able to perform any operation on the Sprint of the board.

h3.Update:
The reason for this behavior is that the *Rank* field needs to be of the type _Global Rank_, if the custom Rank is of any other field type, this behavior will occur.

Updating from GreenHopper to JIRA Agile still leaves 'GreenHopper' in the custom fields' descriptions. As custom fields in JIRA Agile are 'Locked', it is impossible to change the Description without manually manipulating the database.

*+Steps to Reproduce:+*
# Install any version where JIRA Agile was still called GreenHopper;
# Update to the latest version of JIRA Agile;
# See the description of the custom fields

*+Desired Behavior:+*
The description of the custom fields would be updated to reflect the name changes to the product.

*+Actual Behavior:+*
The description still says 'GreenHopper', which will likely confuse new users who are not used to the old naming.
fields.summary: Custom Fields still display old nomenclature ('GreenHopper') in the Description

fields.description:
Recently, a team member (out of frustration) adjusted the Original and Remaining time estimates on an issue to 52w. No one realized it until we all saw the burndown chart start to look very strange (the guideline was basically flat and the red line for remaining values had a nice spike in it). We all laughed...until I realized I couldn't undo it.

In order for the sprint not to be permanently modified on accident (or playfully), it would be beneficial to be able to delete an RTE change record.

The only work-around I see is to prematurely close the sprint and start a new one, which is not acceptable either.

fields.description:
In JIRA, the sub-task that is created after the story has fixVersion will get all the sub-tasks to be part of the same fixVersion. In GreenHopper Classic Board, adding the story to a version will get all its sub-tasks to be updated to the same version as well. This does not apply on the latest JIRA Agile.

It would be good to have the sub-tasks to automatically be added or prompt the user whether to add to the particular version, when the story (its parent) is added to the version. This is known to be a useful feature in Classic board, and lacking of this feature could affect the metrics such in the following scenario (given by customer)

{quote}
- I did not manage to complete the story before end of the version, so I have to move it. The Story will be listed under the new version but the actual work is still in the old version.
- In the version workload report, I cannot see the sub-task efforts in the correct version, so I am mis-lead and will think, I can still add more to the new version, but the workload should already be 100% if the tasks had followed the story.
- In the agile rapid board, the versions list the remaining efforts, but the remaining effort is incorrect because the sub-tasks are in the wrong version.
- In the progress reports (agile and non-agile), the wrongly versioned sub-tasks will show up as an added effort, added too late in the process.{quote}
fields.summary: Adding a story to Version should automatically update its sub-tasks

As well as [Agile Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget] and [Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget] already have, at least for us it's very important that [Agile Wallboard Gadget] also exposes the Sprint filter.

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

If a ticket inside an active sprint is changed from any issue type into an Epic, the ticket will still be visible in the Work Mode of the sprint (inside whichever column it was in previously).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Start a sprint with a few issues inside
# Change the issue type of one of the issues in the sprint into an Epic
# Even though the change is successful, the Epic would still be inside the Work mode column :
!Epics.png|thumbnail!

h3. Other notes

* Problem seem to occur regardless of which column the issue was in prior to the issue type change

h3. 2nd method of reproduction
# Create an issue A of type Story
# Add issue A to the Sprint X
# Convert issue A to become an Epic
** Issue A is still showing in the Work mode of Sprint X
# Create Sprint Y
# Complete Sprint X without moving issue A to the Done (last) column in Work mode
** Issue A has now Sprint Y as a future Sprint when opening the issue
** Issue A is not displayed on the Plan mode under Sprint Y, therefore we can no longer remove it
** When starting the sprint Y, issue A will be effectively an Epic which has a Sprint = Sprint Y, whereas we did not account for that
fields.summary: Active Sprint: Issue transformed into Epic remains in the Working area of the Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Classic boards, in terms of information, were better than the new burndown chart.

We've lost some important information. On Classic Boards we had 5 (colored lines), besides forecasts, with lots of information such as:
1) Remaining Values
2) Remaining Values - Ongoing (dotted line)
3) Remaining Values - Trend (dashed line)
4) Guideline (solid line)
5) Team effort - Completed (solid line)
6) Team effort - Ongoing (dotted line)
7) Estimate accuracy (solid line)
8) Estimate accuracy - Ongoing (dotted line)

The next ones were extremely important for us:
9) Required daily burndown rate (solid line)
10) Required daily burndown rate - Ongoing (dotted line)

Please Atlassian, consider to putting the above information back on the new Burndown Chart.
fields.summary: As a PMO responsible for monitoring projects, mainly burndown charts, it would be great if the information presented on classic burndown could be also presented on the new burndown chart (i.e. [Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget]).

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, ONLY active sprints are demonstrated on GADGETs (i.e.: [Agile Days Remaining in Sprint] AND [Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget]).

After closing the sprint, these gadgets simply expose the following message: "There are no active sprints". And, due that, the only place available to consulting the information is the RapidBoard.

However, in our case, all control regarding to the sprint is in a single painel (JIRA dashboard). Due that, it would be great keep seeing the sprint on those gadgets, even after the sprint is closed.
fields.summary: As a PMO responsible for monitoring dashboards it would be great if sprints could be ALWAYS consulted on monitoring dashboards (through GADGETs, no matter they were finalized or not)

fields.description:
Here is the step to reproduce the issue:
# Install the JIRA agile plugin on JIRA 5.2.x
# Create a new project with a scrum board 
# Create an issue link to link between issue1 and issue2. 
# Display the issue detail on the plan view and it failed for both issue1 and issue2 with the following error: 
{noformat}
An error occurredHide…
Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
Details
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'statusCategory' of undefined
Resource: http://mymac:6521/s/en_US10h4q1-418945332/854/4/f87f04f2effa3135432ccc7a7836806a/_/download/contextbatch/js/gh-rapid/batch.js
Line: 721
Environment
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/30.0.1599.101 Safari/537.36
{noformat} 

It seems that is an compatibility issue with JIRA 5.2.x as it works correctly on JIRA 6.1.x

h3. Workaround

Either of the following can workaround the problem:

* Upgrade JIRA as per [Upgrading JIRA|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA] to the latest version.
* Edit the board configuration in *Board > Configure > Issue Detail View* and remove the "Linked Issues" column from *Links* as per the attached screenshot. After the bug is fixed, remember to add these back. As a side effect no issue links will be displayed for the issue view.

fields.description:
As in the JIRA Agile [6.2.1 release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/GreenHopper+6.2.1+Release+Notes] and [6.3 release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+6.3+Release+Notes], stated that
bq. Some convenient new features include independent scrolling for each panel in Plan mode and Work mode.
This give some confusion of the independent scrolling, is it for each panel of both boards as in Plan Board (versions,backlog,details) and Work Board (statuses) or actually scrolling of the whole board each, and there is no indication whether this is for Scrum or Kanban.

In JIRA Agile 6.2.1 onwards for Scrum:
User could scroll on each panel independently on Plan Board, but unable to do the same for the statuses in the Work Board.

for Kanban:
User could scroll independently on the detail view but not for statuses for the work board.

fields.description:
We have a specific section in our dashboards to demonstrate issues that were removed from the sprint. To do that, we use pre-saved filters with the WAS operator inside the JQL clause.

When an initiative is for just one project and is related to one or more versions to the project, there are no problems. Because, in this particular case, we use the version as the base for JQL and WAS operator is allowed.

But, on the other hand, when the initiative involves more than one project and we we need to use Scrum Rapid Boards with special field SPRINT. This field just doesn't allow history searches.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When installing JIRA Agile through to Add-on Manager, it hangs on installation. If installing it by putting it into {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} and starting up JIRA, JIRA may appear unresponsive.

This is due to upgrade tasks running for instances with large amounts fixVersions (e.g.: 10k+). It can be verified with the following:

{code:SQL}
SELECT count(*) 
FROM   projectversion; 
{code}

If this returns more than 5k records you may be affected by this bug.

(!) Instances with this many fix versions should be reviewed as it's likely they are being created automatically and unintentionally. It's not expected that an instance would ever have this many fix versions.

h3. About the Upgrade Task

JIRA Agile implemented version.startDate before JIRA had the equivalent of this - JIRA now has it's own version of startDate for versions. This upgrade task checks and pushes any startDates stored with JIRA Agile back into the JIRA data if available.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Startup a JIRA instance with a large amount of versions (say 20k+).
# Install JIRA Agile.

h3. Expected Results

The application installs and upgrades seamlessly.

h3. Actual Results

The screen sits on the add-on installation for a decent amount of time and then times out.

(i) Any attempts to access the Add-on Manager will kick off the upgrade attempt again.

h3. Notes

Multiple attempts at proceeding with the upgrade may fix this, as the upgrade tasks could eventually complete.

h3. Workaround

This can be worked around by modifying the database to tell JIRA Agile the versions have been migrated as per the below. This does mean that start dates will *not* be pushed back to JIRA from JIRA Agile.

# Backup JIRA.
# Stop JIRA.
# Run the following SQL:
{code:SQL}
INSERT INTO propertyentry 
VALUES      ((SELECT seq_id 
              FROM   sequence_value_item 
              WHERE  seq_name = 'OSPropertyEntry'), 
             'GreenHopper.properties', 
             1, 
             'GreenHopper.JIRA60.Version.Migration', 
             1); 

INSERT INTO propertynumber 
VALUES      ((SELECT seq_id 
              FROM   sequence_value_item 
              WHERE  seq_name = 'OSPropertyEntry'), 
             1); 

UPDATE sequence_value_item 
SET    seq_id = (SELECT seq_id 
                 FROM   sequence_value_item 
                 WHERE  seq_name = 'OSPropertyEntry') 
                + 10 
WHERE  seq_name = 'OSPropertyEntry'; 
{code}
(i) This is tested with PostgreSQL and may require changing depending upon the DBMS used.
# Start JIRA.
# Test by installing JIRA Agile.
# If there are any problems, rollback to the backed up instance.

h3. Fix

Upgrade JIRA to 6.3.4 or higher and then perform the upgrade - this problem will not be encountered.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile hangs on installation
